document.masterDocTitle: An updated catalogue of the Histeridae (Coleoptera) of Sardinia, with faunistic, zoogeographical, ecological and conservation remarks *

1 ♂ and 1 ♀ ( CUL ); idem
, 30.VI.1954 , 1 ex (DPPS).

Ecology. Shares the same ecological needs as its congeners. Often found together with
S . semistriatus
.

Notes. In Penati and Vienna (2005 , 2006a ) the specimens from “Cagliari” (CGMü) and “Padonti-Nurri” (MSNM, CGD, CGMü) are ascribed, due to an interpretation error, to
S . semistriatus
. Indeed, in the past,
S . subnitescens
was considered a synonym of
S. semistriatus
( cf. Binaghi & Moro 1946 ; Müller 1955 ); this caused considerable confusion regarding the distribution of these two species and of
Saprinus ( Saprinus ) planiusculus Motschulsky
, all three being of very similar appearance and easy to mistake for one another. Despite Luigioni’s (1929) bibliographic record, later cited by Vienna (1980) , no Sardinian specimens of
S . planiusculus
were found in the examined collections. In Penati and Vienna (2005 , 2006a ) the specimens from “Oristano” (CUL) are attributed to
S . semistratus
and their respective data are erroneously given as “Cagliari, 1936, coll. Museo Genova” (see “Data collection”).
